body:
[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #321](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/321/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

Console output on Windows Jenkins:

```
 > git checkout -f origin/master # timeout=10
FATAL: Could not checkout master with start point origin/master
hudson.plugins.git.GitException: Could not checkout master with start point origin/master
```

Does anybody know what this error is about? I didn't change any of the C# files.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #161](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/161/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
It looks like a CI issue with git that shows up before the maven build starts. I tried another build to see if it's a transient build, but the second build also failed with the same message.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #173](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/173/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
This now fails to build from the java side `mvn -PDotNet clean install` fails. Probably because we created a circular dependency between the Java and .NET bits.
Conceptually, REEF.NET depends on Java REEF, but not the other way around. Hence, it might be OK to _only_ be able to trigger a full build from the .NET side. Thoughts?

REEF.Bridge depends on REEF.Bridge.Jar which depends on reef-bridge-java. We shouldn't have circular references theoretically. 
We should be able to trigger build any where. 
If java has been build, we want to make sure it won't be built it again, otherwise it might be built twice and also slower down the build process.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #174](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/174/) FAILURE

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #334](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/334/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
Fixed tests to use the new jar file. So keep the new jar file name in the code.

The build is still unstable. I discussed with @beysims and we came to the following resolution: We'll removed the `DotNet` profile from the maven builds. If people need the .NET build, they will have to initiate the build through MSBuild. I created [REEF-214](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-214) to track this effort.

I will now do a review of this PR.
Review comments are addressed. Could you please merge it?

[Reef-pull-request-windows #175](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/175/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

When I build using `msbuild Org.Apache.REEF.sln /p:Configuration="Release" /p:Platform="x64"`, I get the following warnings:

```
"c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.sln" (default target) (1) ->
"c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Client\Org.Apache.REEF.Client.csproj" (default target) (15) ->
(ResolveAssemblyReferences target) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\12.0\bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets(1697,5): warning MSB3270: There was a mismatch between the processor architecture of the project being built "MSIL" and the processor architecture of the ref erence "c:\src\reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Release\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.dll", "AMD64". This mismatch may cause runtime failures. Please consider changing the targeted processor architecture of your project through the Con figuration Manager so as to align the processor architectures between your project and references, or take a dependency on references with a processor architecture that matches the targeted processor architecture of your project. [c:\src\r eef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Client\Org.Apache.REEF.Client.csproj]


"c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.sln" (default target) (1) ->
"c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.csproj" (default target) (18) ->
  C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\12.0\bin\Microsoft.Common.CurrentVersion.targets(1697,5): warning MSB3270: There was a mismatch between the processor architecture of the project being built "MSIL" and the processor architecture of the ref erence "c:\src\reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Release\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.dll", "AMD64". This mismatch may cause runtime failures. Please consider changing the targeted processor architecture of your project through the Con figuration Manager so as to align the processor architectures between your project and references, or take a dependency on references with a processor architecture that matches the targeted processor architecture of your project. [c:\src\r eef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests.csproj]


"c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.sln" (default target) (1) ->
"c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.All\Org.Apache.REEF.All.csproj" (default target) (19) ->
(BuildPackage target) ->
  EXEC : warning : 3 issue(s) found with package 'Org.Apache.REEF.All'. [c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.All\Org.Apache.REEF.All.csproj]
```

Are those expected?

Also, when I open the project in VS, I get the following warnings:

```
Warning 1   There was a mismatch between the processor architecture of the project being built "MSIL" and the processor architecture of the reference "C:\src\reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Release\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.dll", "AMD64". This mismatch may cause runtime failures. Please consider changing the targeted processor architecture of your project through the Configuration Manager so as to align the processor architectures between your project and references, or take a dependency on references with a processor architecture that matches the targeted processor architecture of your project. Org.Apache.REEF.Client
```

And:

```
Warning 2   There was a mismatch between the processor architecture of the project being built "MSIL" and the processor architecture of the reference "C:\src\reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Release\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.dll", "AMD64". This mismatch may cause runtime failures. Please consider changing the targeted processor architecture of your project through the Configuration Manager so as to align the processor architectures between your project and references, or take a dependency on references with a processor architecture that matches the targeted processor architecture of your project. Org.Apache.REEF.Tests
```
The NuGet contains the jar in a folder called `jars`. They are not copied to downstream project's output folders. I assume this is done in another PR?
It is known issue. I have synced everywhere to use x64. But warning still comes out. Jira #219 is created to follow up it.

I'm looking at it now.

When building from the command line, I still get the following warnings:

```
EXEC : warning : 3 issue(s) found with package 'Org.Apache.REEF.All'. [c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.All\Org.Apache.REEF.All.csproj]

  Issue: Assembly outside lib folder.
  Description: The assembly 'obj\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.All.dll' is not inside the 'lib' folder and hence it won't be added as reference when the package is installed into a project.
  Solution: Move it into the 'lib' folder if it should be referenced.

  Issue: Assembly outside lib folder.
  Description: The assembly 'obj\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.All.dll' is not inside the 'lib' folder and hence it won't be added as reference when the package is installed into a project.
  Solution: Move it into the 'lib' folder if it should be referenced.

  Issue: Assembly outside lib folder.
  Description: The assembly 'obj\x64\Release\Org.Apache.REEF.All.dll' is not inside the 'lib' folder and hence it won't be added as reference when the package is installed into a project.
  Solution: Move it into the 'lib' folder if it should be referenced.
```
This doesn't actually remove the guava dependency, does it? I believe with these changes, we can drop guava from the pom.
We don't have any direct maven dependencies on Guava to remove. Guava (11.0.2) gets picked up transitively, via REEF's hadoop and reflections dependencies.
@jwang98052 Is that warning expected?
@dafrista: Excellent, thanks! I will test and merge this today.
@yingdachen This has been overrun by recent changes, it seems :-) Can you close the PR as I _believe_ the issue is already addressed.
All the architectures have been synced in build.prop that is shared. Haven't found the root cause that caused the warning. It doesn't impact the client though.
Shall we file another issue for it then? That way we can at least merge this.
I filed [REEF-229](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-229) to track this and will merge this PR.

for some weird reason I cannot get access to Git (even Gmail is a fight to
finally get into...), could you, or Julia, close this for me?

Thanks,
-Yingda

@yingdachen, we don't have admin access to the Apache git account. Hence, we cannot close this PR, only you can. We'll just let it sit here till you are back. Safe travels :-)
@dkm2110 This PR is no longer mergable with `master`. Can you please resolve merge conflicts on your end?
